rev.comment: This image use does not comply with [[WP:NFCC]] #10c and MUST be removed until it does. Thank you.
rev.diff:
Line 303: Line 303:
==Crest==
==Crest==
â
[[Image:Oldmanchestercitylogo.png|thumb|150px|Manchester City crest from 1972â1997|alt=A round badge with the words "Manchester City F.C." around the edge. In the middle is a shield with a ship in the upper half and red rose in the lower half]]
 
City have previously worn two other crests on their shirts. The first, introduced in 1970, was based on designs which had been used on official club documentation since the mid-1960s. It consisted of a circular badge which used the same shield as the current crest, inside a circle bearing the name of the club. In 1972, this was replaced by a variation which replaced the lower half of the shield with the red rose of [[Lancashire]].
City have previously worn two other crests on their shirts. The first, introduced in 1970, was based on designs which had been used on official club documentation since the mid-1960s. It consisted of a circular badge which used the same shield as the current crest, inside a circle bearing the name of the club. In 1972, this was replaced by a variation which replaced the lower half of the shield with the red rose of [[Lancashire]].
===Current crest===
===Current crest===
â
[[Image:Manchester City.svg|thumb|left|150px|Manchester City crest from 1997-present|alt=Eagle with phrase, "superbia in proelia" meaning "Pride in Battle" in latin]]
  â  
The current club crest was adopted in 1997, the exact reason of the crest change is believed to have been down to problems copyrighting the pre-1997 crest with the club stating: "''an unsatisfactory situation had developed at Manchester City regarding the licensing out of the round badge on an ad hoc basis which has led to a number of problems with counterfeit goods. This we felt was leading to a devaluing of the Manchester City brand, and consequently its badge in both the modern market and in football.''"<ref name="crestmc">{{Cite web |title=Club Crest |url=http://mcivta.com/club/history.html |publisher=mcivta.com |accessdate=6 November 2010}}</ref> however some claim this is not the true reason for the new crest.<ref>{{cite web |title=City and its Crest |url=http://blog.umbro.com/2009/06/15/city-and-its-crest/ |publisher=blog.umbro.com |date=15 June 2009 |accessdate=12 August 2010}}</ref>.
The current club crest was adopted in 1997, the exact reason of the crest change is believed to have been down to problems copyrighting the pre-1997 crest with the club stating: "''an unsatisfactory situation had developed at Manchester City regarding the licensing out of the round badge on an ad hoc basis which has led to a number of problems with counterfeit goods. This we felt was leading to a devaluing of the Manchester City brand, and consequently its badge in both the modern market and in football.''"<ref name="crestmc">{{Cite web |title=Club Crest |url=http://mcivta.com/club/history.html |publisher=mcivta.com |accessdate=6 November 2010}}</ref> however some claim this is not the true reason for the new crest.<ref>{{cite web |title=City and its Crest |url=http://blog.umbro.com/2009/06/15/city-and-its-crest/ |publisher=blog.umbro.com |date=15 June 2009 |accessdate=12 August 2010}}</ref>.
